    CI/CD Workshop | R in Pharma 2022

    R in Pharma 2022 CI/CD workshop repository.

    Full workshop video available here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OcNzurpCCpY

    Presentation video available here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8HPpdv8crHo

    Exercises

    Exercise 1

    Fix issues identified by R CMD check workflow.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” A unit test is failing for hello.R.


    Click here for the solution âœ… The expected message should be Welcome to the R/Pharma CI/CD workshop! (R/Pharma is missing from the message) in the tests/testthat/test-hello.R file.

    Exercise 2

    Fix broken links after implementing the Check URLs workflow.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” An R/Pharma link is broken in the NEWS.md file.


    Click here for the solution âœ… The rinpharma website domain is incorrectly set as .xcom. It should be .com.

    Exercise 3

    Find and fix all spelling errors determined by the Spellcheck workflow.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” One or more words are misspelled in the NEWS.md file.


    Click here for the solution âœ… The word link is misspelled as linke in NEWS.md. The word strangephrase should be strange phrase in NEWS.md. Fix the spelling first in the NEWS.md file. Next, simply run spelling::update_wordlist(confirm=â€œYesâ€) to add technical jargon to the wordlist.

    Exercise 4

    Fix code style errors implementing the Style workflow.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” Thereâ€™s a minor style issue in the R/hello.R file.


    Click here for the solution âœ… Simply run styler::style_file(â€œR/hello.Râ€) to automatically style the file.

    Exercise 5

    Reduce the cyclomatic complexity identified by the Lint Code Base workflow.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” The issue is manifested in the R/hello.R file.


    Click here for the solution âœ… Reduce the number of if statements to reduce the cyclomatic complexity in the R/hello.R file for the linter_ex() function. Run styler::style_file(â€œR/hello.Râ€) to fix style issues, if any. Then, run lintr::lint_package() iteratively to determine whether the issue has been resolved.

    Exercise 6

    Update man pages based on the errors reported by the ROxygen workflow.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” Function documentation is not up-to-date for R/cicdworkshop-package.R and the linter_ex() function.


    Click here for the solution âœ… Simply run roxygen2::roxygenize(â€˜.â€™, roclets = c(â€˜rdâ€™, â€˜collateâ€™, â€˜namespaceâ€™)) or devtools::document() to automatically update all man pages.

    Exercise 7

    Increase code coverage for the package.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” Add a simple unit test for the linter_ex() function defined in the R/hello.R file.


    Click here for the solution âœ…

    Run covr::package_coverage() to note the current code coverage.

    In the tests/testthat/test-hello.R file, add the following test:

    test_that("linter_ex is surprised", {
  expect_message(
    linter_ex("lint"),
    "^Whoa!\\n"
  )
})

    Run tests locally by executing devtools::test() to make sure that the tests succeed.

    Then, run covr::package_coverage() to see that the code coverage has increased.

    Exercise 8

    Publish a website for your package using GitHub Pages.

    Click here for a hint ğŸ” Update the _pkgdown.yml and add the pkgdown workflow.


    Click here for the solution âœ… Update the url by replacing pharmaverse with your GitHub username and repository name.
